alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone; Colfax; Cuming; Madison; Platte; Stanton; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, southern Wayne, northern Cuming, northwestern Colfax, northern Platte, southeastern Antelope, western Thurston, Boone and Stanton Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Thurston to 5 miles east of Madison to 5 miles northwest of Albion. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Madison around 450 PM CDT. Pender around 500 PM CDT. Creston around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Leigh, Rosalie, St. Edward and Bancroft. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northeastern Nebraska. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Boone; Colfax; Cuming; Madison; Platte; Stanton; Thurston; Wayne
